title: Learner-Generated Virtual Patient Curriculum Development and Implementation Program for Surgical Residents

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic surgical diagnostics and procedures, with 1â€“2 years of clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining virtual patient simulation platforms with real clinical settings. Applies a constructivist model emphasizing peer assessment and self-directed learning.

learning_goals: Participants can establish diagnostic and treatment plans for major surgical conditions with 85% accuracy by analyzing virtual patient cases created by peers.
Learners can produce content that fully reflects standard clinical guidelines and medical evidence during the development of virtual patient cases.
After training, participants can demonstrate mastery of at least 70% of core learning objectives for in-training exams and prove case-solving competencies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
